I do network science, graph algorithms, graph theory, dynamical systems and complexity science in general. But really, a lot of it is computational plant biology. And most of it relies on simulations.

Oh, yes, I almost forgot, the probability of an event is the fraction of times it occurs, and that's it.
How strongly one believes in something does not change the underlying reality.

Your statutory rights are not affected.
